project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Version Warnings do not report "Unreviewed Code" added *after* pull request was *merged* using Bitbucket (with automated transitions setup)

We need the JIRA provided data concerning these warnings to be accurate.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Steps:
1) create feature/ branch from JIRA (issue goes to In Progress)
2) create commits on that feature/ branch with the the JIRA issue key in commit message
3) create and complete a pull request for that feature/ branch (issue goes to In Review then completed). Pull request has been merged now. 
4) create additional new commit on that feature/ branch & push to the server. 
5) review JIRA detailed releases view for the assigned fix version 
 - No warnings for the additional unreviewed commit which was after the merge.

 - The issue is listed in the issues done" section.
 - The extra commit is listed in the commits from the development column commit link 
 - The bitbucket pull request does not list the commit not reviewed for the issue. 

h3. Expected Results

1. For Jira to report in the warning section about the "unreviewed Code" for the issues which have merged pull request, and additional commits (un-reviewed)  has been added to an issue.

Or

*2. Jira and/or Bitbucket should be configured to prevent post PR merge commits from being made to assure that the JIRA unreviewed code report is always accurate.*

As KB for [Merge a pull request|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/merge-a-pull-request-945541513.html] states, Merging your changes is the *final stage* of the pull request process, hence Bitbucket should not allow further commits to be added, as per my knowledge, Github won't allow this. 
h3. Actual Results

Jira does not warn about the "unreviewed Code" for the issues which have merged pull request, and additional commits (un-reviewed)  has been added to the issue. The report is inaccurate.
h3. Workaround

No workaround exists. The report is inaccurate and not usable. 

Asking developers not to make commits after pull request is merged is not an acceptable workaround for customers.
fields.summary: Jira Version Warnings do not report "Unreviewed Code" added after pull request was merged using Bitbucket (with automated transitions setup)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Following [Splitting a Jira instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/splitting-a-jira-instance-720412266.html] documentation and linking both Jira's together makes you require to OAuth approve Jira Software's Version Report gadget access. This is not expected as the approval is not required when making the same configuration for instances of non-common origin (both set up independently, that is not cloned ones).

Before splitting Jira has to generate it's own OAuth consumer key (e.g. by creating application link to other instance).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Jira (Title: "Jira1", port: 8080) with sample project
# Link this Jira to any other Jira application, so it generates it's Oauth consumer ({{oauthconsumer}} table)
# [Split the Jira instance|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/splitting-a-jira-instance-720412266.html]
## Copy Jira insallation, database and jirahome
## For the copy:
### Change jirahome location and port (8081)
### Change "{{jira.sid.key}}" as mentioned in [Changing Server ID|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-server-id-for-test-installations-285839562.html] documentation
### Start Jira
### In ⚙>"System">"General configuration" 
#### Adjust "Base URL" to match the port (8081)
#### Change "Title" ("Jira2")
# For "Jira1"
## In ⚙>"Applications">"Application links"
### Create new link to "Jira2"
## Create new Dashboard
## Add "Version Report" Gadget from Jira Software and configure it with default configuration.

h3. Expected Results
The gadget displays only the chart.

h3. Actual Results
The chart is displayed, but the gadget also asks for "Login & approve" of the local Jira instance.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-24 at 16.42.14.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
The issue is happening because both Jira instances have same OAuth consumer key.

Other gadgets could be affected, but so far only Version Report was identified to behave this way.

It's likely that the issue was present before Jira 7.2.0, but it wasn't verified.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Login & approve" required for Version Report gadget when Jira has application link to it's own clone

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

This essentially describes the same situation as [JSWSERVER-6136 : As a manager, I want to filter out subtasks from my Agile Board columns but still allow the detail view's subtasks tab to show them|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-6136], however, instead focuses on allowing the Admin and User to configure whether they want to see the Subtasks or not.

The goal is to allow for Subtasks to not show on the Board Columns, but still have their details available on a Task/Story/Issue's Details.

h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for a configuration option (such as a checkbox/toggle somewhere on the Board screen itself) which show or hide Subtasks on the Board Columns, without affecting their visibility in an Issue's Details.

h3. Why this is important
 
Depending on an organization's workflow, Admins and Users may prefer if Subtasks are visible on a board column, or perhaps hidden (If there are too many Issues/Subtasks in view). Rather than force one or the other, the application could be more flexible by providing the option to the Admin or User.

h3. Workaround 
{quote}For now, you can use the Work sub-filter to work around this. If you set the main Board filter to include all your Issues, including sub-tasks, and then add a sub-filter, e.g. Type != Sub-task (depending on your configuration), sub-tasks won't be displayed on the Board, but will be visible in the Issue Detail pane.{quote}
fields.summary: As an admin or user, I want to configure whether or not Subtasks are visible in my Agile Board Columns, while still being shown in Issue Details

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

If you add a JQL that is more than 255 in length will result in that JQL to not be added. However, that is no warning presented to the user that their JQL exceeded the length. 

h3. *Suggested Solution* 

Add a warning to tell the user that the JQL is not added with the reason of why it is not added. 

h3. *Why this is important*

This is important so that users know that their JQL is not added and why this limitation. 

h3. *Workaround*

You can create normal Issue Filters with your JQL and then join them: 
{code:none} 
filter = "Filter for BBB" AND filter = "Filter for BBB 2" 
{code} 
This way you can spread the JQL across multiple JQL.
fields.summary: Add a warning for the JQL that exceeded the max length of 255 in Card colours

fields.description:
This is really two suggestions, but they directly relate to each other, so I will only create one suggestion :) Resolving and collapsing/hiding comments is the more desirable feature out of the two. There is nothing on the market place that achieves BOTH of these features at the same time...
 # The comment section of work items can get rather difficult to follow if there are multiple topics raised. It would be ideal that replies to an existing comment appear in a thread, and threads can be collapsed.
 # When there are many comments in a work item it can be very time consuming to find information that still requires actions. Ideally, comments and entire comment threads could be marked as resolved, and then collapsed by the viewer.
 ** In extension to this, it would be excellent if the workflow could be configured to require all comments be resolved before any DONE status is permitted.
 ** GitLab has done this quite well, although the presentation could be improved upon. I've included a screenshot of their solution ;)
!image-2019-01-17-07-20-08-087.png!
fields.summary: Comments can be threaded and resolved

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Please make it possible to disable "Detail view" when selecting an issue on a kanban or scrum board. It is extremely irritating to see "Detail view" pop out on the right screen. First of all, "Detail view" is too narrow and makes the information look to tight so it's not like it offers extra functionality when it comes to viewing issues. You have to scroll down inside the panel quite a bit if you want to look at, for example, screenshots within that issue. It's always so much easier to open an issue in another window or tab so you get all the information. Also... when "detail view" appears it pushes and tightens all other issues on the board making it slightly more difficult to click on another one. 

I believe this is something the users have wanted for a long time now. I found an old thread in which people were even voting to be able disable this "feature". 

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11160?_ga=2.260804046.2123857962.1547471653-1511871041.1542786021

Please make it possible for us to disable this or just disable the feature altogether.
fields.summary: PLEASE disable "Detail view"

fields.description:
As Product Owner I use links between Jira User Stories in order to define dependencies, e.g. the dependency “has to be done before/after”. These dependencies can cover a sequence of several user stories.

In my product backlog I have a large amount of user stories, which are ordered by priority (rank). There are user stories without links user stories with links. 
 If I move a user story in my backlog, i.e. I do a re-prioritization, I want to have a simple way  to move the whole group of linked user stories to the new position in the backlog.

In the current version I have to move all stories one by one. E.g. the whole group of stories could be moved automatically when one story is moved. Alternatively, all linked stories could be selected if you select one story out of the group and then you can move them as a group.
fields.summary: Move groups of linked user stories in a product backlog

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Commit messages where the Jira issue key is preceded with a plus sign (+) are not linked in Jira - ie. missing from the commit section of the development panel. For example a commit message like 'commit to +BLA-13' will not create a commit link in Jira. It will 'link' correctly in Bitbucket. 

h3. Environment

Tested with Jira 7.6.9 and Bitbucket 5.7.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Link a Jira 7.6.9 and Bitbucket 5.7.1 instance
# Create a Repo
# Create a commit and mention '+<Jiraissuekey>'. For example, use the commit message: {{git commit -m 'Initial commit of all files to the repository +BLA-11'}}

h3. Expected Results

The commit message shows in the Commit area of the Jira issue. The commit message shows in Bitbucket with a link to the Jira issue. 

h3. Actual Results

The commit message shows and is linked in Bitbucket. The commit is missing from the Development panel in Jira. 

See the below screenshots for examples: 

*Commit in Bitbucket* 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

*Development Panel in Jira* 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround
Do not use a + sign immediately before the Jira issue key. Leave a space between the + and issue key.
fields.summary: Commit messages where a plus sign directly precedes a Jira issue key are missing from the development panel

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Commits, PRs and etc. that is related to a repository that is created with the same name of the deleted repository will not be synced to JIRA.

Further digging into this matter, it looks like JIRA is able to retrieve the repository name, however, it is not creating the Webhook (for Github/Github Enterprise) and Services (for Bitbucket Cloud) after the repository syncing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create the JIRA - Github or JIRA - Bitbucket integration.
# After the sync is done, delete one of the repositories on Github or Bitbucket.
# Refresh the repo list on JIRA.
# Create a new repo with the same name on Github or Bitbucket.
# Refresh the repo list on JIRA.
# Navigate to the repo Webhook (on Github) or repo Services (on Bitbucket) - there will be no Webhook (for Github/Github Enterprise) or Services (for Bitbucket Cloud) created.

h3. Expected Results
There will be Webhook (for Github/Github Enterprise) and Services (for Bitbucket Cloud) created for the newly recreated repo with the same name of a deleted repo.

h3. Actual Results
Navigate to the repo Webhook (on Github) or repo Services (on Bitbucket) - there will be no Webhook (for Github/Github Enterprise) or Services (for Bitbucket Cloud) created.

h3. Workaround
Recreate the JIRA - Github or JIRA - Bitbucket integration.
fields.summary: Data related to repository that is recreated with the same name will not be synced

./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/fugue-retry-4.5.0.jar
 
Likewise Jira:
[monty@monty-XPS-15-9570|mailto:monty@monty-XPS-15-9570]:/opt/atlassian/jira
$ sudo find . -name *.jar  | grep -i fugue
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/fugue-4.5.0.jar
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/fugue-guava-4.5.0.jar
{color:#ff0000}./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/fugue-2.6.0.jar{color}
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/fugue-retry-4.5.0.jar
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/fugue-4.5.0.jar
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/fugue-guava-4.5.0.jar
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/fugue-scala-4.5.0.jar
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/fugue-optics-4.5.0.jar
./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/fugue-retry-4.5.0.jar
 
Is there anything "environmental" that causes the different version of fugue to be used? The reason I'm suggesting this that the Azure Ubuntu image is a factor. We use always use the "latest" Azure image (which gets frequently updated):
 
$ az vm image list --location canadacentral --publisher Canonical --offer UbuntuServer --sku 16.04-LTS --all --output table
Offer         Publisher    Sku        Urn                                               Version
------------  -----------  ---------  ------------------------------------------------  ---------------
UbuntuServer  Canonical    16.04-LTS  Canonical:UbuntuServer:16.04-LTS:16.04.201611220  16.04.201611220
...
UbuntuServer  Canonical    16.04-LTS  Canonical:UbuntuServer:16.04-LTS:16.04.201811140  16.04.201811140
UbuntuServer  Canonical    16.04-LTS  Canonical:UbuntuServer:16.04-LTS:16.04.201812040  16.04.201812040
UbuntuServer  Canonical    16.04-LTS  Canonical:UbuntuServer:16.04-LTS:16.04.201812070  16.04.201812070
UbuntuServer  Canonical    16.04-LTS  Canonical:UbuntuServer:16.04-LTS:16.04.201812230  16.04.201812230
 
I noticed the Guava error started occurring midway through the 23rd Dec where the new image "16.04.201812230" presumably started to come into effect. Specifying the version to be "16.04.201811140" rather than latest Jira + JSD start up successfully. However this isn't the only time I have seen this error - as part of [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/DC/pages/359629496/Upgrading+Azure+Jira+Nodes], I attempted to deploy old Ubuntu images too (with the intention of seeing them upgraded) and there were a number of them raising the exact same issue. At the time I just kept on going to I got a working image just putting it down to JDK 7/8 OS issues. Given that Jira + JSD comes with it's own Oracle JDK (and clearly uses it from the logs), this is extremely weird but also easily reproducible as well. I have attached logs were we downgrade to "16.04.201811140".
 
Either way given that Fugue is an internal Atlassian library I don't see any reason to be using a deprecated version of it in the latest release of Jira and JSD. Hardcoding the Azure Ubuntu image either isn't going to be feasible either, given we'll miss out on latest security updates.
h3. Environment

* Azure Ubuntu 16.04 LTS image -  16.04.201812230


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Deploy Jira or JSD to an Azure 16.04 LTS 16.04.201812230 image

 
h3. Workaround

Moved from "latest" 16.04 LTS version to "16.04.201811140" version.
fields.summary: IllegalAccessError - Guava Iterators.emptyIterator() + Fugue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When ranking issues in both Scrum and Kanban, it is [documented|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/ranking-an-issue-777002780.html] that you need both 'Schedule Issue' and 'Edit Issue' permissions. This works as expected in Scrum boards. However, in Kanban board issues can still be ranked with 'Schedule Issue' permission only (without the 'Edit Issue' permission).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a software project, edit the permission scheme.
 # Set the 'Schedule Issue' permission to a user / group (e.g. Group_A)
 # Set the 'Edit issue' Permission to another group (e.g. Group_B)
 # Create Two boards, one Kanban and one Scrum.
 # Login with a user who does not have the 'Edit issue' Permission but has the 'Schedule Issue' Permission. (e.g. who belong to Group_A)
 # Try to rank the issues in the Scrum board, it works as expected, the ranking does not work and an error is returned that the user does not have the permission to edit the issues.
 # Switch to Kanban board and try to rank the issues. Issues are ranked without displaying any error message.

h3. Expected Results

Issues will not be ranked in Kanban as the user does not have the 'Edit issue' permission similar to Scrum boards.
h3. Actual Results

Issues are ranked in Kanban board. The rank column does reflect this change too.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in Scrum and Kanban boards ranking permissions

h3. Problem Definition

Currently {{findRapidViewsByProject}} scans all _RapidViews_ to find Boards which are related to a specific project.

 Expected result: updateLastVisitedProject finishes is reasonable time...
h3. Suggested Solution

Skip permission check at the JQL scan stage and do permission check only after filtering.
h3. Notes

See JSWSERVER-16130 for more context

fields.description:
h4. Issue Summary

When an issue is split after a sprint has been started, the remaining values line shows the new issue resulting from the split as 'work added'. This results in an inaccurate representation of the remaining work in burndown reports. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a Scrum board to use Story Points as the estimation statistic.
 # Add several stories to a sprint and estimate.
 # Start sprint.
 # Split one issue that has been estimated to 5 points- estimate the new one to 2 points, old one to 3.
 # View Sprint burn downchart.
 # View Release burndown chart.

h3. Expected Results

Remaining values remains unchanged as the actual amount of remaining work is unchanged - or-  points are added as a scope change to the new issue and points are removed as a scope change to the old (and actual value remains unchanged).
h3. Actual Results

The sprint burndown chart shows the new issue created from the split as a scope change and adds two story points to the graph.

!Image 2018-11-30 at 4.07.10 PM.png|thumbnail!

The release burndown chart also shows inaccurate values for remaining work (3 has been subtracted as 'completed' work and 2 has been added): 

!Image 2018-12-03 at 8.25.27 AM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Remaining value is accurately reflected in the table below. See screenshot below. Note the table shows 16 points remaining vs the chart (screen shot above)which shows 18. A possible solution for this would be to first check if an issue was split from a parent and use the parent's creation date for the chart (so that the work is not counted as a scope change). 

!Image 2018-11-30 at 4.07.17 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Remaining Values of burndown charts inaccurate after splitting an issue in a sprint that has started

fields.description:
Jira 'versions' should be linked with Bitbucket 'release branches'

Now, Jira can say a version is finished, just because the issues are DONE and MERGED, but it could done it better if when a 'version' is created it can be linked with a 'release branch' in Bitbucket:
 * it could detect if all issues in that fixVersion are in the corresponding 'feature branch'. Now, if by mistake you commit one of the issues to another branch, you dont get any warning
 * it could detect if more issues than expected are added to that 'release branch'. It is common mistake to add more changes to a release than expected
 * 'Build and release' option should be disabled if any of the above condition happens, and the 'version' must shown as incomplete and the reason (some missing issue not in the release branch, some not expect issue there)
fields.summary: Link JIRA 'versions' to Bitbucket 'release branches'

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
When an issue has been added after the sprint has started and resolved within that sprint for the first time, the behavior is correct, where the Sprint report shows that this issue is completed in this sprint. However, when you over back to backlog and set to In Progress (due to some issues with development) and move it back to the same active Sprint then eventually completing it for the second time, the Sprint report shows that this issue is _Issues completed outside of this sprint_ which is not expected. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue and set a story points of 50. Let's call is MON-36.
# Create a new sprint and one issue to it MON-26 w
# Start working on the new issue MON-36 while it is still in the backlog and transition it to _In Progress_.
# Move MON-36 to the active sprint and confirm the scope change.
# Visit the Sprint report and both MON-26 and MON-36 appear.
# Resolve MON-36 in the active sprint and visit the Sprint Report. 
!1.png|thumbnail!
# Move MON-36 back to the backlog and set to _In Progress_ one more time. 
# Move MON-36 back to the active sprint for the second time and resolve it. 
# Visit the Sprint Report and it shows MON-36 under _Issues completed outside of this sprint_ section 
!2.png|thumbnail!
# Complete the Active Sprint and there's no change in the Sprint Report.
# The Velocity Chart shows 0 in the Completed section of this sprint whereas it should show 50. 

h3. Expected Behavior
No matter how many times the issue has been resolved in a sprint, as long as it is closed within the active sprint, it should be included in the Completed issues.

h3. Actual Behavior
The first time it was resolved in the Active Sprint was totally fine. Only the second time that it resulted to a strange behavior where MON-36 shows under the _Issues completed outside of this sprint_ section 

h3. Notes
It is indeed a very rare used case but then the behavior is not correct.
fields.summary: Incorrect behavior about "Issues completed outside of this sprint" when the issue has been resolved twice in a sprint.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Kanban backlog board is being used in a gadget on a dashboard, a Kanplan acknowledge section is being rendered on top of it with the following text:

{quote}A bigger and better backlog has just landed
We've created a dedicated space for you to plan in the new Kanban backlog. This board will now be a distraction-free zone for your team to focus on work-in-progress.{quote}

That acknowledgment has links like "Take me there", "Close", etc, and none of them are working when viewed on the dashboard. The same links work fine when the acknowledgement is viewed in the board view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Kanban project
# Create a Kanban board
# Enable Kanban feature by dragging unmapped status to the leftmost column in "Columns" configuration of the board
# Use this board in a dashboard gadget

h3. Expected Results
Users are able to dismiss the alert when rendered on a dashboard.

h3. Actual Results
Clicking on any links in the alert do nothing. Nothing is logged in the Javascript console either.
 
h3. Workaround
It is possible to disable the banner altogether by modifying {{$JIRA_INSTALL/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/application-installation/jira-software-installation/jira-greenhopper-plugin-xxxx.jar/atlassian-plugin.xml}} and commenting out all sections referencing KanplanAcknowledge resources:

{code:xml}<!--<resource type="download" name="KanPlanAcknowledge.js" location="includes/js/rapid/ui/kanplan/KanPlanAcknowledge.js"/>-->
<!--<resource type="download" name="KanPlanAcknowledge.soy.js" location="includes/js/rapid/ui/kanplan/KanPlanAcknowledge.soy"/>-->{code}

Save the modified file in a JAR file, and restart Jira for change to take effect.
fields.summary: Links in Kanplan acknowledge feature in dashboards are not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary

We need to update the documentation on the [Printing issue cards|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver076/printing-issue-cards-941595687.html] document it's not possible to print multiple cards post selection like the document says it does:
{quote}
*Tips:*
 * To print multiple issue cards, select the issues while pressing and holding down the 'Shift' or 'Ctrl' key, and then right-click > Print selected cards. The Print window displays the number of issue cards for printing.
{quote}

The *"Print selected cards"* option is *not* available

h3. Environment
* Tested on 7.6.9
* The scope could be other versions as well


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Scrum board.
# Click an issue, press Shift and proceed to select 2 other issues.
# Right click at one of the selected issue to see that print option is not shown.

h3. Notes
This behaviour has been recorded already through:
* [JSWSERVER-16108|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-16108]
* [JSWSERVER-15892|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-15892]

h3.Workaround
Current workaround is to:
* Either create a "quick filter" to the scrum board and then print all visible issues by clicking "Board >> Print cards"
* Or plugins like Agile Board Filter could help as well

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If a *Sprint Burndown Gadget* is added to a dashboard while the user in their profile a different language than Jira's default, all *Sprint Burndown Gadgets* will be rendered in that language until Jira is restarted.

h3. Environment
* Jira 7.11.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log into Jira as *User A*, which must have its language set to Jira's default.
# Create a new project with sample data, by navigating to *Projects > Create Project > Create sample data > Scrum software development*.
# Log off, then log in as *User B*.
# Create a new dashboard and share it with all logged-in users.
# Change language to French by navigating to *Avatar Icon > Profile*.
# Add a new *Sprint Burndown Gadget* to the newly created dashboard. The gadget text should be displayed in French as expected.
# Log off, then log in as *User A*.
# Navigate to the dashboard created by *User B* in a previous step. Note how the gadget text is still displaying in French.
# Create a new dashboard and share it with all logged-in users.
# Add a *Sprint Burndown Gadget* to the newly created dashboard. The gadget text will still be displayed in French.

h3. Expected Results
* The gadget's text is displayed in the user's language.
* New gadgets added to dashboards are displayed in the user's language.

h3. Actual Results
* The gadget will be displayed in French for all users.
* New gadgets will be displayed in French despite that not being the user's language.
 !user-lang-en-gadget-lang-fr.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
It seems like the gadget will always be rendered using the language of the first user who loaded it.

h3. Workaround
No direct workaround available, but restarting Jira will allow for the gadget to be loaded using another language depending on the user who first loaded it.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadget is rendered in the language of the user who first loaded it

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The current board creation only allows the following parameters to be configured:
* Board from new project: project name, key, and lead 
* Board from existing project: board name and project
* Board from existing Saved Filter: board name and saved filter

Administrators would like to have a feature to allow individual administrators / group of administrators to be added to the board admin during the creation process itself.
 !Screen Shot 2018-11-14 at 09.56.42.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
During the board creation, add a feature to define the group / individual administrators to be added to the board

h3. Why this is important
During the absence of the scrum master, the team of administrators will be able to assist on the board administration

h3. Workaround 
The current feature only allow individual / group administrators to be added to the board after the board was created

 !Screen Shot 2018-11-14 at 09.59.53.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screen Shot 2018-11-14 at 15.06.40.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Adding an Individual / Group of Administrators During Board Creation

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We are executing permission check for every issue assigned to epic.

h3. History
It was used in pre-7.2 UI to determine if currentUser can remove epic from given issue.
Based on the results of this check we were showing 'delete' button in the epic label.

h3. Now
In 7.2.0 we've rewritten the UI and now it doesn't need this parameter.

h3. Suggestion
Don't execute this permission check

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Loading of Backlog is slow in case of many Epics.
One of the reasons is count of linked pages for epic.
To compute this number we execute 2 DB queries for each epic:
* Load Epic issue by key. (API requires issue :()
* Count number of links for that issue.

To see this number you need to 
* Open Epics panel
* Expand epics

So, in most of the cases results of that expensive operation are not used...

h3. Suggestion
'Retire' showing number of epic links.
Users will still have access to those links, but the label will be static.
fields.summary: Backlog - Epic linked pages trigger extra DB queries

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Loading of Agile board can slow down due to the number of issues with subtasks.
For each subtask we are loading parent issue from database to get {{parentKey}} by {{parentId}}.
It trigger an extra db query for each issue having subtasks


h3. Suggestion
Load all parents from index and init {{parentKey}} in one action
fields.summary: Boards - Subtasks trigger many extra DB queries

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Today agile boards allow quite limited options to prioritize items: Top of backlog (or a swimlane), Bottom of a backlog (or swimlane). 

For projects with big backlogs it's not always helpful - because for some features, as a Jira user and a Product Manager on my project,  I have a pain via drag-and-drop an item to the right place when I don't want it to be put to the very top/bottom. So, I would suggest more flexible prioritization options.  

For example: 
 * Top and Bottom 10% of a backlog
 * Top and Bottom 25% of a backlog
 * Mid of backlog
 * and so on...

So like imagining the backlog in the form of virtual 'percentiles' with the ability to quickly rank an issue into the appropriate percentile. 

Thoughts for percentiles (green exist today, blue are to add): *{color:#00875a}Top{color} , {color:#4c9aff}*Top 10%, Top 25%, Mid, Bottom 25%, Bottom 10%*{color}, {color:#00875a}Bottom{color}*. 

While specific 'percentiles' can be different, I hope the overall pain and the idea how to improve are more or less clear. 

 

Thank you.
fields.summary: More flexibility in prioritizing items on scrum/kanban boards

h4. Summary
Burndown Chart does not keep initial remaining time correctly when work log happens soon after sprint starts

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue with estimation of 3 days
# Add it to sprint and start sprint
# In the same minute, log work of 1 day (remaining time now is 2 days)
!history.png|thumbnail!

h4. Expected Result
The burndown chart should still show the initial remaining time as 3 days, and have another entry of work log of 1 day, with remaining time of 2 days now

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we try to print a an issue card that has long text, the text get cut off.

h3. Environment

Jira Software (Agile)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# go to a board that has a field with long text
# right click and select "print selected card"
# check the result

h3. Expected Results

Entire card contents get printed.

h3. Actual Results
The text description exceeding the width of the card is cut off.
 
h3. Notes
 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

# Right click the text that doesn't fit on the card, and choose "Inspect element", or "Inspect" depending on your browser.
# This opens a console, look for the window/tab that says "Rules" or "Styles" and find one that ends with ".ghx-card-xfield-value", you have to scroll down a bit.
# There, uncheck the line that says "white-space: nowrap;". All the description text is in the card now.
fields.summary: Printing issue cards from board, text gets cut off
